details.title: All COVID-19 UPDATES FROM OCTOBER 27
details.content:
Gujarat records 992 fresh cases of virus infection, five deaths and other coronavirus updates from October 27
(READ UPDATES HERE)

details.title: Pfizer optimistic it can still deliver a Covid-19 vaccine in 2020
details.content:
Pfizer executives expressed measured optimism Tuesday over the prospect of providing a coronavirus vaccine in 2020 as the pharma giant reported lower third-quarter profits due to disruption in healthcare that dented drug demand.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Phase 1 Bihar elections have begun with strict COVID-19 protocols
details.content:
This is the first time India is condcuting state assembly elections amid a pandemic

Gaya: People deployed on polling duties seen wearing masks and gloves; sanitizers to be used during the voting that will begin shortly, which is first of its kind after #COVID19 pandemic. #BiharElections pic.twitter.com/WuF6C0jx2h

— ANI (@ANI) October 28, 2020

details.title: For first time after May, Chennai COVID-19 cases below 700
details.content:
• For the first time since May, Covid cases in Chennai went below the 700-mark on Tuesday, with 695 testing positive.
  • Meanwhile, Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital (RGGGH) in the city recorded zero deaths due to Covid in 24 hours, for the second time in a span of four days.

(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: More cases in Mizoram
details.content:
80 new #COVID19 cases reported in Mizoram, taking the total number of positive cases to 2,607 till date.

The number of active cases is at 374 while 2,233 people have been discharged so far.

No death reported in the state till date: Government of Mizoram pic.twitter.com/S4ZHqo9uAB

— ANI (@ANI) October 28, 2020

details.title: PM tweets
details.content:
I urge all voters to ensure their participation in this festival of democracy while taking precautions against #COVID19, tweets PM Narendra Modi

Polling for the first phase of #BiharElections is underway. pic.twitter.com/zpnHTA15BF

— ANI (@ANI) October 28, 2020

details.title: WATCH | Polling booths sanitised
details.content:
#WATCH | Bihar: Sanitization underway at polling booth number 56 and 57 in Munger; people queue up at the polling booth while maintaining social distancing.

Polling for the first phase of #BiharElections is underway. pic.twitter.com/6htG2XLUcZ

— ANI (@ANI) October 28, 2020

details.title: People vote in Bihar
details.content:
Bihar: First phase polling of Bihar Assembly elections underway, following #COVID19 norms.

Visuals of voters queuing up outside booth number 43 in Paliganj and undergoing temperature check. pic.twitter.com/EDMDKDZITp

— ANI (@ANI) October 28, 2020

details.title: 508 deaths in India
details.content:
With 43,893 new #COVID19 infections, India's total cases surge to 79,90,322. With 508 new deaths, toll mounts to 1,20,010.

Total active cases are 6,10,803 after a decrease of 15,054 in last 24 hrs

Total cured cases are 72,59,509 with 58,439 new discharges in last 24 hrs. pic.twitter.com/oF0l5Dm2E8

— ANI (@ANI) October 28, 2020

details.title: 21 new cases in Andamans
details.content:
• The COVID-19 tally of Andaman and Nicobar Islands rose to 4,274 on Wednesday as 21 more people tested positive for the infection, a health official said.
  • Five new patients have travel history, while 16 infections were detected during contact tracing, he said.
  • Twenty-two more people have been cured of the disease, the official said.
  • The Union territory now has 197 active coronavirus cases, while 4,019 people have recovered from the disease and 58 patients have succumbed to the infection so far, he said.

details.title: 1,481 fresh cases in Telangana
details.content: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) accounted for the most number of cases with 279, followed by MedchalMalkajgiri 138 and Rangareddy 111 districts, a government bulletin said on Wednesday providing data as of 8 PM on October 27.

details.title: Jharkhand tally crosses 1 lakh-mark
details.content:
• Jharkhand's COVID-19 tally crossed the 1 lakh-mark on Wednesday as 318 more people tested positive for the infection, a health official said.
  • The new cases have taken the state's caseload to 1,00,224, he said.
  • Four more people have succumbed to the infection, pushing the state's coronavirus death toll to 876, the official said.
  • Jharkhand now has 5,474 active cases, while 93,874 people have been cured of the disease so far, he said.

details.title: Delhi schools to remain closed
details.content:
All government and private schools in Delhi to remain closed until next order: Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/9y6Eb4GK2I

— ANI (@ANI) October 28, 2020

details.title: Delhi schools to remain closed
details.content:
"We keep getting feedback from parents that they are really concerned about whether it is safe to reopen schools. It is not. Wherever schools have reopened, COVID-19 cases among children have risen. So we have decided that as of now schools in the national capital will not reopen. They will continue to be closed till further orders," Sisodia said.
(CLICK TO READ MORE)

details.title: 102 new cases in Pondicherry
details.content:
• Puducherry posted 102 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, taking the infection count to 34,583 in the union territory.
  • Two more people, including a 55-year old woman, died of the illness during the last 24 hours raising the toll to 590.
  • Director of Health and Family Welfare S Mohan Kumar said in a release that the two deceased had complaints of diabetes and hypertension.

details.title: Thane reports 22 more deaths
details.content:
• Thane has added 703 new COVID-19 cases, taking the tally in the Maharashtra district to 2,08,294, an official said on Wednesday.
  • At least 22 more deaths due to COVID-19 have also been reported in the district, raising the toll to 5,262, he said.
  • So far, Kalyan in the district has reported the maximum number of COVID-19 cases at 49,421, followed by Thane city-45,730, Navi Mumbai-43,869 and Mira Bhayander-22,264, the official said.
  • Out of the total number of deaths, Thane city has reported 1,137, Kalyan-999, Navi Mumbai-885 and Mira Bhayander-701, he said.
  • As of now, there are 10,310 active COVID-19 cases in the district, while 1,92,722 patients have recovered.

details.title: Tripura registers 160 new cases
details.content: Single-day recoveries outnumbered new COVID-19 cases in Tripura, as 160 more people tested positive for the infection while 202 more people were cured of the disease on Wednesday, a health official said. The new cases have pushed the northeastern state's COVID-19 caseload to 30,453, he said.

details.title: Arunachal reports 81 cases
details.content: Arunachal Pradesh's COVID-19 tally rose to 14,472 on Wednesday as 81 more people tested positive for the infection, a health official said. An undertrial prisoner lodged in Jully Central Jail succumbed to the infection at a hospital on Tuesday, taking the state's coronavirus death toll to 36, he said.

details.title: Health ministry's telemedicine initiative eSanjeevani completes 6 lakh teleconsultations
details.content: eSanjeevani, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare’s telemedicine initiative has completed 6 Lakh teleconsultations. It took only 15 days to complete the last one lakh consultations. States like Tamil Nadu, Kerala and Gujarat run eSanjeevani OPD for 12 hours a day and 7 days a week. It is a testimony to the fact that eSanjeevani is gradually gaining traction with patients and doctors: Government of India

details.title: Mizoram records its first COVID death
details.content: Mizoram, the only state which had not reported any COVID-19 fatality so far, registers its first coronavirus death: Health official

details.title: DGCA extends suspension of scheduled intl passenger flights till Nov 30
details.content:
DGCA extends suspension of scheduled international passenger flights till November 30. However, such flights may be allowed on selected routes by the competent authority on a case-to-case basis, according to a circular.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Air India flights barred in Hong Kong over COVID-19
details.content: Hong Kong bars Air India flights for fourth time as passengers test positive for COVID-19. Previous bans were on the airline's Delhi-Hong Kong flights during September 20-October 3 and August 18-August 31 and October 17-October 30.

details.title: Noida schools struggle to get students back in classrooms
details.content: Private schools in Noida struggle to get students of classes 9 to 12 back in classrooms as parents continue to feel unsafe to send their wards to schools amid COVID-19 outbreak

details.title: Nagaland reports 98 new cases
details.content: 98 fresh COVID19 positive cases and 114 recoveries reported in the state today: Nagaland Health Minister

details.content:

details.title: Mizoram COVID tally
details.content: Mizoram reports first COVID19 death & 5 new recoveries today. Total number of positive cases are 2,607 now, including 368 active cases and 2,238 recoveries.

details.title: Situation not back to normal: Delhi's first COVID patient
details.content: Delhi's 1st COVID19 patient Rohit Datta cautions people to stay indoors as much as possible during festive season, stresses situation is "not back to normal". Datta, 46, who tested positive on Mar 1, urges people to not lower their guard by getting into casual festive mode

details.content:

details.title: Tamil Nadu CM Palaniswami urges authorities to ensure strict implementation of norms
details.content: Tamil Nadu CM E K Palaniswami rues that about 35 per cent of people in the state don't wear mask, urges authorities to ensure strict implementation of safety protocols in the wake of COVID19 pandemic.

details.title: Maharashtra govt urges Railways to allow travel of passengers of non-essential category in non-peak hours
details.content: Maharashtra Government has written to the Railways and has requested it to allow travel for passengers of non-essential category in non-peak hours. The state government has proposed to re-open Mumbai local service for general public & suggested three slots for travel. It has also proposed two slots for people related to essential services and one ladies special train every hour.

details.title: Smriti Irani tests positive for COVID
details.content:
It is rare for me to search for words while making an announcement; hence here’s me keeping it simple — I’ve tested positive for #COVID and would request those who came in contact with me to get themselves tested at the earliest ????

— Smriti Z Irani (@smritiirani) October 28, 2020

details.title: DCGI gives nod to Johnson & Johnson's Covid vaccine trials in India
details.content:
The subject expert committee under the CDSCO on Covid-19 gave its approval on Monday after analysing the data from the pre-clinical trials or animal studies.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: BCG shot may enhance immunity against Covid-19 in the elderly: ICMR study
details.content:
Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) is a live–attenuated vaccine strain of Myobacterium 63 bovis that provides protection against mycobacterial infections such as tuberculosis and leprosy, neonatal sepsis and respiratory infections and lowers childhood mortality. In India, this vaccine is administered to babies at birth as part of the government’s universal immunisation programme.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: J&K records 536 new cases of COVID
details.content: 536 new COVID19 cases reported in Jammu and Kashmir today; 199 from Jammu division and 337 from Kashmir division. Total number of cases now at 93,213 including 6,976 active cases, 84,782 recoveries and 1,455 deaths: Govt of Jammu and Kashmir

details.title: Manipur COVID tally
details.content: Manipur reported 205 new COVID19 infections today, taking the total cases to 17,6809 out of which 4,233 are active cases. The total number of deaths stands at 156.

details.title: Gujarat witnesses six fresh deaths due to COVID
details.content: Gujarat's COVID-19 tally rises to 1,70,053 with 980 new cases; toll up to 3,704 with 6 fresh deaths: Health Department

details.title: Civil Aviation ministry establishes new air bubble between India and Tanzania
details.content: An air bubble arrangement has been established between India and Tanzania. Designated carriers of both countries are permitted to operate flights between the two countries: Ministry of Civil Aviation

details.title: Punjab COVID tally
details.content: Punjab reported 528 new COVID19 cases, 356 discharged cases & 20 deaths, taking total positive cases to 1,32,263 till date, including 1,23,866 discharges, 4,239 active cases & 4,158 deaths: State Health Department

details.title: Rajasthan tally
details.content: Rajasthan detects 1,785 new COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths today till 6pm. Total positive cases in the state stand at 1,91,629 including 1,877 deaths, 1,74,044 recoveries and 15,708 active cases: State Health Department

details.title: Puducherry to launch health insurance scheme
details.content: The Puducherry health department is set to launch a health insurance scheme for 2.17 lakh families who are not covered under the Ayushman Bharat scheme by December 2020. (READ MORE)

details.title: Maharashtra tally
details.content: Maharashtra reports 6,738 new COVID-19 cases, 8,430 recoveries and 91 deaths, as per State's Public Health Department. The COVID19 tally of the state rises to 16,60,766, with 14,86,926 recoveries and 43,554 deaths. Active cases at 1,29,746

details.title: Govt issues clarification on Arogya Setu app
11 COVID-19 care centres shut in Latur as cases decline
details.content: Considering the decline in the number of coronavirus cases and rise in recoveries, the local administration in Maharashtra's Latur district has temporarily shut 11 COVID-19 care centres, an official said on Wednesday. (READ MORE)

details.title: 'First set of COVID-19 vaccines likely to be imperfect'
details.content: Kate Bingham, Chair of the UK's Vaccine Taskforce set up earlier this year to coordinate global efforts in search of a viable vaccine against the novel coronavirus, said it is important to manage expectations as the early discoveries are unlikely to prove the "silver bullet" that the world is hoping for to get to grips with the pandemic. (READ MORE)

details.title: Tamil Nadu's death toll crosses 11000-mark
details.content: Tamil Nadu’s COVID-19 death toll crossed the 11,000-mark on Wednesday, with 35 deaths being reported on the day. The toll is now 11,018, having added 1,000 deaths in the last 20 days. (READ MORE)

details.content:
#COVID19 cases in Delhi seeing steep rise. Crossed 5k daily positive figure for first time.

details.title: Dad COVID positive, Lakshya Sen pulls out of SaarLorLux Open
details.content: Misfortune led to badminton player Lakshya Sen's withdrawal from the SaarLorLux Open in Germany on Wednesday. Tipped to be one of the favourites, he was looking forward to defending his crown. (READ MORE)

details.title: Doctors of Hindu Rao hospital call off strike
details.content: The doctors of Hindu Rao Hospital and other North Delhi Municipal Corporation-run facilities have called off their strike today. Jai Prakash, NDMC Mayor says, "The salaries of doctors, nurses, paramedical staff, technicians and ward boys have been paid till September."

details.title: Jharkhand tally
details.content: Jharkhand reports 345 new COVID-19 cases, 452 recoveries/discharges and 4 deaths today. Total cases in the State rise to 1,00,569, including 94,326 recoveries/discharges and 880 deaths. Active cases stand at 5,363

details.title: German healthcare system about to collapse, says Merkel
details.content: The coronavirus incidence in Germany is very high, and if this continues, the healthcare system will reach its limits in a few weeks, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Wednesday. (READ MORE)

details.title: Kochi firm to launch cheaper, more accurate COVID test kit
details.content: Agappe Diagnostics, a Kochi-based medical devices company, is all set to launch a new Covid-19 test kit on November 10, which according to the manufacturers, is affordable and gives quicker and accurate results. (READ MORE)
